intro: Bolbitis taylorii, commonly known as the Taylor's shield fern, is a rare and distinctive fern species native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It is characterized by its unique, shield-shaped fronds that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant thrives in cool, moist, and shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, a common feature among ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bolbitis taylorii is considered a vulnerable species.
